thread.title: Lamar Odom out of coma, speaking and opened eyes, reports say
thread.title_full: Lamar Odom out of coma, speaking and opened eyes, reports say

title: Lamar Odom out of coma, speaking and opened eyes, reports say
text:
Lamar Odom out of coma, speaking and opened eyes, reports say Updated October 16, 2015 6:28 PM By CRISTIAN SALAZAR Reprints + - Lamar Odom is out of a coma, and has spoken and opened his eyes, according to E!, the network that airs "Keeping Up With the Kardashians," and other news outlets. Here, Odom and Kardashian arrive for the 19th annual Race to Erase MS themed "Glam Rock to Erase MS" in Los Angeles on May 18, 2012. Photo Credit: Getty Images / Frederic J. Brown 
advertisement | advertise on newsday 
Lamar Odom has opened his eyes and has been able to communicate at a hospital where he was taken after being found unresponsive at a Nevada brothel, according to news reports Friday. 
Odom, 35, opened his eyes and gave his estranged wife, reality TV star Khloe Kardashian, a thumbs-up and said, "Hey, baby," before going back to sleep, a source tells E! News, which also reports he is out of a coma and no longer using a breathing tube. The E! Network airs "Keeping Up With the Kardashians." Odom appeared on the show and starred in its "Khloe and Lamar" spin-off. Most popular Story Kardashians release a statement on Lamar Odom Story Kardashian with Odom after he's found unconscious Photos Khloe Kardashian 
The former NBA star and Queens native appeared to respond to voices, USA Today and Entertainment Tonight reported citing unnamed sources at the hospital. 
Entertainment Tonight also reported that when asked whether he wanted to see his children, the 35-year-old estranged husband of Khloé Kardashian said "Yes." 
Odom was rushed to the hospital Tuesday after a three-day binge at the Love Ranch in Crystal. TMZ and other celebrity news organizations have reported that he had overdosed on a cocktail of drugs. He was found facedown by two women who had gone to check on him, the brothel’s owner told The Associated Press. 
advertisement | advertise on newsday 
Odom, whose highly publicized marriage to Kardashian was documented on “Keeping Up With The Kardashians,” was taken to a nearby hospital, but it was determined that he needed to be airlifted to another facility; however, his 6—foot-10 frame was too big for the helicopter. He was driven by ambulance to Sunrise Hospital and Medical Center in Las Vegas, where he has remained since. 
E! News reported that several basketball players, including Kobe Bryant, had visited Odom.
